SEARCH
Package org.rcmd.jneuroformats

Class FsMghData

java.lang.Object
org.rcmd.jneuroformats.FsMghData
public class FsMghData extends Object
Models a FreeSurfer label, can be a surface label or a volume label. The label is defined by a set of vertices or voxels that are part of the structure, and a value that is assigned to all vertices or voxels that are part of the structure. Sometimes the value is not needed, and can be set to 0.

  • Field Details

    • dataMriFloat

      public float[][][][] dataMriFloat
      4D float array for MRI_FLOAT data. MRI_FLOAT is a float (32 bits).

    • dataMriInt

      public float[][][][] dataMriInt
      4D float array for MRI_INT data. MRI_INT is a signed int (32 bits).

    • dataMriShort

      public float[][][][] dataMriShort
      4D float array for MRI_SHORT data. MRI_SHORT is a signed short (16 bits).

    • dataMriUchar

      public float[][][][] dataMriUchar
      4D float array for MRI_UCHAR data. MRI_UCHAR is a unsigned char (8 bits).

    • mriDataType

      public int mriDataType
      The MRI data type, one of the MRI_* constants defined in FsMgh. This tells you which of the data arrays to use.

  • Constructor Details

    • FsMghData

      public FsMghData(int mriDataType, int dim1Size, int dim2Size, int dim3Size, int dim4Size)
      Constructor for FsMghData with data.
      Parameters:
      mriDataType - the MRI data type, one of the MRI_* constants defined in FsMgh. This tells you which of the data arrays to use.
      dim1Size - size of dimension 1
      dim2Size - size of dimension 2
      dim3Size - size of dimension 3
      dim4Size - size of dimension 4

    • FsMghData

      public FsMghData()
      Default constructor for FsMghData. Initializes empty arrays.

    • FsMghData

      public FsMghData(FsMghHeader header)
      Constructor for FsMghData with header.
      Parameters:
      header - the FsMghHeader from which to obtain information on which data arrays to create.

  • Method Details

    • fromByteBuffer

      public static FsMghData fromByteBuffer(ByteBuffer buf, FsMghHeader header) throws IOException
      Read an FsMghHeader instance from a Buffer in FreeSurfer MGH format. Reads the header and advances the buffer to the data part of the file.
      Parameters:
      buf - the buffer to read from.
      header - the FsMghHeader instance that has already been read from the buffer.
      Returns:
      an FsMghData instance.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs, or if the file is not in valid MG format.

    • writeFsMghDataToByteBuffer

      protected ByteBuffer writeFsMghDataToByteBuffer(ByteBuffer buf, FsMghHeader header) throws IOException
      Write the FsMghData to a ByteBuffer.
      Parameters:
      buf - an existing ByteBuffer to write to. If null, a new ByteBuffer will be created. Typically this should be an existing ByteBuffer filled partly, with the header bytes, and with enough space to hold the FsMghData.
      header - the FsMghHeader from which to obtain information on which data to write. This header will not be written to the ByteBuffer.
      Returns:
      the ByteBuffer, with the FsMghData written to it.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.
